identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Antitumor Activity of SIM0237 in Adult Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase I First-in-human, Open-label, Multicenter Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Antitumor Activity of SIM0237 in Adult Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors

collaborators.name: Shanghai Xianxiang Medical Technology Co., Ltd.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a multicenter, open-label, phase I study to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and pharmacokinetic (PK)/pharmacodynamic(PD) characteristics of SIM0237 in participants with advanced solid tumors.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study starts with a dose escalation part (Part 1) followed by a dose expansion part (Part 2). The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of SIM0237 and determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) (if any) and/or the recommended dose(s) (RD) and preliminary anti-tumor activity when given once every week or other dosing regimens. Additional purposes of the study are to evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) properties, immunogenicity, correlation of the biomarkers and PK profile with anti-tumor activity.

conditions: Locally Advanced Unresectable or Metastatic Solid Tumor

armGroups.label: Experimental: PART ONE- Dose escalation
armGroups.description: The purpose of the Dose Escalation Phase (Part one) is to characterize the safety and tolerability of SIM0237 and determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) (if any) and/or the recommended dose(s) (RD) based on the frequency of the occurrence of DLTs in each cohort during the DLT evaluation period.

armGroups.label: Experimental: PART TWO- Dose expansion
armGroups.description: Patients will be administered a recommended dose of SIM0237 established from the Dose Escalation Phase of the study.

interventions.name: SIM0237
interventions.description: SIM0237 should be administered intravenously at recommended dose qw or other dosing regimens

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation (Part One): Incidence and nature of Dose-Limiting Toxicity (DLT)
primaryOutcomes.description: DLTs will be defined using NCI CTCAE version 5.0 or ASTCT criteria for Cytokine Release Syndrome (CRS).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation (Part One): Percentage of participants experiencing treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcomes.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), and lab abnormalities, according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5.0 and American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) consensus grading

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation (Part One): Percentage of participants experiencing AE related dose interruptions and dose delays, dose intensity
primaryOutcomes.description: Occurrence of AE related dose interruptions, dose delays and dose intensity (duration of SIM0237 exposure).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Expansion (Part Two): Objective Response Rate (ORR)
primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants who have a confirmed Complete Response (CR) or a Partial Response (PR), as the Best Overall Response (BOR) determined by Investigator per the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Expansion (Part Two): Percentage of participants experiencing treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), and lab abnormalities, according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5.0 and American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) consensus grading

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Expansion (Part Two): Percentage of participants experiencing AE related dose interruptions and dose delays, dose intensity
secondaryOutcomes.description: Occurrence of AE related dose interruptions, dose delays and dose intensity (duration of SIM0237 exposure).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Assessment of SIM0237 Cmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: Maximum concentration observed (Cmax) observed from the PK profile

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Assessment of SIM0237 AUC
secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the concentration versus time curve calculated using the trapezoidal method

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Assessment of SIM0237 T1/2
secondaryOutcomes.description: The time it takes for half the drug concentration to be eliminated calculated using slope of the terminal line

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Assessment of SIM0237 antibody (ADA)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence, duration, titer of serum anti-SIM0237 ADA

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation (Part One): Objective Response Rate (ORR)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants who have a confirmed complete response (CR) or a Partial Response (PR), as the Best Overall Response (BOR) determined by Investigator per the RECIST v1.1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Duration Of Response (DOR) assessed by investigator per RECIST Version 1.1
secondaryOutcomes.description: DOR is defined as the time from the measurement criteria are first met for CR/PR (whichever is first recorded) until the first date that recurrent or progressive disease.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Disease Control Rate (DCR) assessed by investigator per RECIST Version 1.1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Disease Control Rate is defined as the percentage of participants who have achieved CR or PR or have demonstrated stable disease

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) assessed by investigator per RECIST Version 1.1
secondaryOutcomes.description: PFS is defined as the time from the date of first administration of SIM0237 to the date of the first documented disease progression determined by Investigator as per RECIST 1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Time-To-Progression (TTP) assessed by investigator per RECIST Version 1.1
secondaryOutcomes.description: TTP is defined as the time from the date of first administration of SIM0237 to the date of the first documented disease progression

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: Overall Survival (OS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Overall Survival is defined as the time from the date of first administration of SIM0237 to death due to any cause

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dose Escalation and Expansion: ORR in participants with different PD-LI expression levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: ORR is defined as proportion of participants who have a confirmed Complete Response (CR) or a Partial Response (PR), as the Best Overall Response (BOR) determined by Investigator per RECIST v1.1. PD-L1 expression will be tested using 22C3 IHC and scored using TPS and/or CPS algorithm.

locations.facility: Indiana University Melvin and Bren Simon Comprehensive Cancer Center
University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
